body: @sushobhit27 I think this happens because there is a bug with `local_attr`, which we use to fetch the `__init__` method from the local class or from the parents. the bug is that it might also consider the methods from `object`, which is the default base in Python 3. We most likely need to look into `local_attr` to fix this bug at the source.

@Pierre-Sassoulas This message is never raised in our test suite. See https://coveralls.io/builds/48335404/source?filename=pylint%2Fcheckers%2Fclasses%2Fclass_checker.py L808.

However, this seems very controversial. It is perfectly reasonable not to have an `__init__` for a class. It doesn't seem like people mind very much (there is no other issue about this message). Shall we just remove the message in `2.14`?

issue.title: Remove the 'no-init' message tat was not emitted anyway

issue.title: [M1627] Add filters for ProjectSummarySampleEventViewSet

repository.name: mermaid-api
repository.description: Core authenticated MERMAID data read/write API

issue.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- New Features
  - Unified read-only project sample event view with an explicit access field; serializer and endpoints now use this view and return results ordered by project ID.
  - Expanded filtering: country, site, management, tags, and JSON-record icontains lookups.

- Performance
  - Added GIN indexes on JSON records to speed JSON-based filtering/searches.

- Chores
  - Database migrations added to create the consolidated view; migration SQL may be resolved at runtime.

- Tests
  - Test setup updated to ensure the consolidated view is created for test runs.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

issue.title: [M986] Cross project images endpoint

repository.name: mermaid-api
repository.description: Core authenticated MERMAID data read/write API

issue.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Read-only Images API with list/detail endpoints and top-level /images route.
  * Responses include project_id and project_name; supports filtering by project ID/name.
  * Access restricted to authenticated users for their associated projects.
* **Refactor**
  * Image-to-project resolution now prefers observation-derived projects.
* **Tests**
  * Added tests for auth, access control, listing, and retrieval; new test fixtures included.
* **Chores**
  * .gitignore updated to exclude a token-generation script.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

issue.title: [M1671] Demo Project

repository.name: mermaid-api
repository.description: Core authenticated MERMAID data read/write API

issue.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Users can create a demo project; each user may have only one demo project.

* **Improvements**
  * Demo projects are flagged as demo and set to test status; duplication preserves ownership and handles demo templates with clearer errors.
  * DEMO project ID added to settings (env-specific value).

* **Bug Fixes / Chores**
  * Test runner output flag removed; test dependency entry cleaned.

* **Tests**
  * Image test fixtures refactored to use in-memory uploaded files.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

issue.title: add cloud trail and guard duty

issue.body:
Cloudtrail events
https://554812291621-nliw25mz.us-east-1.console.aws.amazon.com/cloudtrailv2/home?region=us-east-1#/trails

Guardduty Dashboard:
https://554812291621-nliw25mz.us-east-1.console.aws.amazon.com/guardduty/home?region=us-east-1#/summary

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Enabled CloudTrail audit logging with multi-region support, centralized log delivery, encryption, versioned storage, lifecycle retention and delete-operation alerts.
  * Added GuardDuty deployment with runtime monitoring, malware protection for specified buckets, service-linked role provisioning, and detectors for multiple threat signals.
  * Provisioned supporting monitoring and execution roles to enable EC2/ECS runtime insights and automated detector management.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
